weather_report:
This afternoon, Downtown San Francisco offers a vibrant escape, bathed in sunlight that casts a warm glow over the iconic skyline. Highs near 60 create a comfortable atmosphere for afternoon wanderings, although temperatures will gently drift downwards. A light north wind flutters through the streets, invigorating but not biting, promising a delightful experience for anyone stepping outside. As the day eases into evening, a transformation awaits; clouds will roll in with the advancing hours, bringing a likelihood of rain after 4 a.m. The skies will shift into a partly cloudy canvas, hinting at opportunities for reflection and rest.

While the current conditions seem inviting, one might note a subtle hint of anticipation in the air—perhaps a sign of the approaching rain. The clarity of the day remains commendable, with visibility stretching over the hills and the bay, whispering tales of urban adventures. Dressing in layers becomes wise; a light jacket would serve you well, ensuring warmth without sacrificing comfort as the chill of night creeps in. As dusk approaches, consider strolling through the vibrant neighborhoods or indulging in a quiet café, enveloped in the ambiance of the city. A captivating evening awaits, with the rhythm of the impending rain weaving a narrative of cozy respite.
